Studenti pozvali profesore da se izjasne o prolongiranju roka za doktorat Siniše Malog

04 Nov 2019, 15:10

Predstavnica pokreta "1 od 5 miliona" Mila Jovanović danas je u ime studenata pozvala profesore koji su podržali blokadu Rektorata da se izjasne da li je odlaganje donošenja odluke o doktoratu ministra finansija Siniše Malog za 15 dana zaista neophodno ili je namerno odugovlačenje.Jovanović je na konferenciji za novinare u zgradi Rektorata rekla da je odluka o doktoratu zbog koje su studenti blokirali rektorat u septembru, trebalo da bude doneta danas, ali je odložena za 22. novembar zbog navodnog previda da postoji rok od 15 dana za žalbe.Ona je dodala da će studenti odluku o tome kako će reagovati na dodatno odugovlačenje u donošenju odluke o doktoratu Malog saopštiti sutra, nakon što se o toj odluci izjasne i profesori."Pozivamo onih 800 profesora koji tvrde da je doktorat Siniše Malog plagijat da se izjasne o ovom prolongiranju. Uzećemo u obzir šta profesori kažu i donećemo odluku u naredna 24 sata. Profesori, ovo je vaša odgovornost, ono što je trebalo da uradite pre šest godina. Ako se ne izjasnite znaćemo da smo mi jedini stub koji čuva čast ovog univerziteta", poručila  je Jovanović.Jovanović je rekla i da je studente danas u zgradi Rektorata sačekalo novo obezbedjenje "koje se neprimereno ponaša prema studentima", kao i da je obezbedjenje najverovatnije tu "zato što se rektorat plaši reakcije studenata koji su spremni da ponovo blokiraju rektorat kao što su jednom to već uradili"."Za nas je doktorat Siniše Malog plagijat. To potvrdjuje i FON sa njihovom sramnom odlukom da jedan deo doktorata nije lepo citiran. Čak i sredjoškolci znaju kako se citira", rekla je Jovanović i dodala da studenti neće prihvatiti bilo kakvu drugu odluku osim da je doktorat Siniše Malog plagijat.Rektorka Univerziteta u Beogradu (BU) Ivanka Popović saopštila je ranije danas da zbog poštovanja procedure BU neće moći u najavljenom roku da sprovede dogovor postignut sa aktivistima Udruženja "Jedan od pet miliona" o spornom doktoratu ministra finansija Siniše Malog.Dogovorom kojim je prekinuta blokada Rektorata BU najavljeno je da će utvrdjivanje autentičnosti doktorata Malog biti završeno do 4. novembra, ali ga nije moguće sprovesti zbog poštovanja roka od 15 dana za podnošenje žalbe na odluku Naučno-nastavnog veća Fakulteta organizacionih nauka (FON) o javnoj osudi Malog zbog neakademskog ponašanja prilikom pisanja doktorata.

Students invited professors to speak on the extension of the deadline for Sinisa Mali's Ph.D.

04 Nov 2019, 15:10

Today, on behalf of students, Mila Jovanovic, a spokeswoman for the "1 in 5 Million Movement," called on professors who supported the blockade of the Rectorate to say whether delaying the decision on the PhD by Sinisa Mali for 15 days was really necessary or deliberate. told a press conference at the Rectorate building that a decision on the doctorate that blocked students from the rectorate in September should have been taken today, but was postponed to November 22 for allegedly overseeing a 15-day deadline for appeals. She added that students will announce the decision on how to respond to the additional delay in deciding on a doctoral degree for Mali, after the professors have made their decision. "We invite those 800 professors who claim that Sinisa Mali's doctorate is plagiarized to declare this prolongation. We will take into account what the professors say and make a decision in the next 24 hours. six years ago. If you do not declare, we will know that we are the only pillar that holds the honor of this university, "Jovanovic said. Jovanovic also said that students were waiting for new security in the Rectorate building today" that treats students inappropriately, " and that security is most likely there "because the Rectorate is scared of the reactions of students who are ready to re-block the Rectorate as they once did." "For us, Sinisa Mali's PhD is plagiarized. This is confirmed by the FON with their shameful decision that a part of the doctorate was not nicely quoted. Even high school students know how to quote, "Jovanovic said, adding that students would not accept any decision other than that Sinisa Mali was a plagiarist. University of Belgrade (BU) Rector Ivanka Popovic announced earlier today that she would not be able to comply with the BU procedure. within the announced deadline to implement the agreement reached with activists of the Association of One in Five Million on the controversial doctorate of Finance Minister Sinisa Mali.The agreement that broke the blockade of the BU Rectorate announced that the authentication of the doctorate of Mali would be completed by November 4, but it is not possible to comply with the 15-day deadline for lodging an appeal against the decision of the Faculty of Organizational Sciences (FON) Scientific-Educational Council on the public condemnation of Mali for non-academic conduct while writing his doctorate.
